item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2022-11-16-08:00

item.title: Manager Reporting & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager Reporting & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Data is a critical asset that can be used to fuel business growth and distinguish RBC around the globe.  RBC’s Chief Data Office is setting the standards for data governance, helping move RBC to be a data-driven organization that leverages data to build long-term business advantage!
 
RBC is starting with the position that data is a critical asset that can be used to fuel business growth and allow us to differentiate and distinguish RBC around the globe.  If you’re hungry for a high performance culture in a fast–paced environment and believe in your ability to deliver, this is your opportunity to be part of RBC’s data family.
 
We’re looking for someone to join the Chief Data Office’s reporting team to help set the enterprise direction. Sound like you?  If so, review the description below and tell us why you’re the winning candidate.  Don’t go unnoticed!

What will you do?

  • Evaluate and recommend best approaches & practices, with a focus on re-usability, scalability, and innovation.
  • Establish and support the data collection, information gathering, and data analysis of reports for the Chief Data Office
  • Perform requirements stakeholder analysis to identify impacted or influencing groups and stakeholder requirements responsibilities
  • Prepare requirements for review by applying various communication techniques and lead requirements walkthrough and sign-off sessions
  • Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates
  • Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
  • Gauge the usability of new and existing reports and make constructive suggestions for change

What do you need to succeed?

Must-haves:

  • A willingness to self-earn
  • Pivot and change direction as dictated by our client\'s changing needs
  • Knowledge of data visualization and report dashboards.
  • Experience providing and prioritizing requirements to the IT team.
  • Experienced consolidating data from multiple sources into a single report/dashboard.
  • Proven ability to gather Business and Systems requirements independently, having strong business analysis and systems analysis skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Requirements methodology (planning, elicitation, documentation) - such as Waterfall, Iterative, and/or Agile as well as Tableau and working knowledge of SQL.
  • Effective written & oral communication skills to explain difficult concepts, influence, and build consensus.
  • Strong knowledge and experience with data/information management concepts and governance practices.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Consulting skills, with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change, and performance measurement.
  • Understanding of current data-related topics regarding government / regulatory requirements, emerging trends, and issues.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

item.title: Manager, Advice Centre Transformation Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Advice Centre Transformation Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for a Data Analytics Manager to join our growing team of data engineers, scientists, developers and analysts. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing and detecting trends, and providing insights to our AC transformation and strategy business partners. You will be responsible for collaborating with product leads and data analysts to design, launch and iterate on user-centric data insights use cases.

Please Note: This is a hybrid opportunity for applicants within commuting distance to the Meadowvale office location.

What will you do?

  • Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to support AC and mega journey transformation leveraging statistics, metrics and models
  • Regularly conduct analytics to identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships.
  • Deliver reporting and analytics on transformational metrics to track the success of treatment plans.
  • Design solutions which deliver data based insights to relevant stakeholders, simplify user experience and address user pain points
  • Collaborate with data engineers to source and question and understand data

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 2+ years’ experience in data analytics, using Python, SQL, data visualization (Tableau or similar)
  • First-hand experience working with popular Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and notebook environments
  • Qualitative and quantitative capabilities, and solid experience in utilizing data to inform a story to drive change
  • Strong understanding of data and statistics, with the ability to convert insights into action effectively
  • Knowledge of Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, HDFS, Hive)
  • Professional oral and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate between technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, economics or related quantitative field

Nice to have:

  • Experience working on an Agile team
  • Advice/Contact Centre knowledge

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An opportunity to further develop people management skills
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues, identifying causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

Please Note: While the work arrangement for this opportunity is primarily remote, you may be required to periodically attend an approved RBC office location.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity

Nice-to-have

  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations
  • egree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the financial models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. EPM technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners.

What will you do?

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have:

  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Sr. Manager, CRM Strategy & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, CRM Strategy & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This role will be a member of the team supporting Marketing, Engagement, and CRM for Avion Rewards. Avion Rewards is a rapidly evolving program which requires the incumbent to be able to think fast, strategize in-depth, and proactively drive initiatives to conclusion with business partners.

What will you do

  • Provide proactive project management support to ensure cross enterprise marketing strategies are executed to plan and accurately measured post-campaign

  • Develop tests for various touch points in a client’s onboarding and post-acquisition life cycle, extract insights out of the tests, and deliver iterative improvements to our channels such as email, push notification, and in-app messaging

  • Work with enterprise and third-party partners to develop and maintain strategies, models, and processes associated with offer personalization.

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of our data collection capabilities, mature our monitoring and reporting stack, and recommend actions to ensure completion of business KPIs.

  • Optimize allocation of marketing spend to drive higher acquisition volumes and greater cost efficiency

  • Identify and streamline processes and mechanisms in order to reduce turn-around time, simplify work flows, and increase throughput

Must-haves:

  • Prior experience in business analytics, marketing strategy, acquisition strategy, or other quantitative strategy roles

  • Proven experience in designing marketing tests, analyzing results, and iteratively improving the business based on extracted insights

  • Strong technical skills in manipulating data via tools such as SAS, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop

  • Ability to communicate complex technical processes and insights in an audience friendly manner

  • Demonstrated effectiveness dealing with ambiguity and change

  • One RBC mentality, willingness take on whatever is required to elevate the business

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with advertising, engagement, and analytics toolsets such as Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Salesforce Market Cloud, Facebook Analytics

  • Budgeting and planning experience managing large scale marketing programs

  • Prior experience working in loyalty, rewards, or digital advertising businesses

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help all of our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

This role will be a member of the team supporting Marketing, Engagement, and CRM for Avion Rewards. Avion Rewards is a rapidly evolving program which requires the incumbent to be able to think fast, strategize in-depth, and proactively drive initiatives to conclusion with business partners.

item.title: 2023 Summer Student, Global Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 Summer Student, Global Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk measurement of market and counterparty credit risk for trading book. Given the increasing importance of assessing the financial impacts of climate change to financial institutions, GRA is also building expertise in climate risk analytics to support RBC’s various climate risk stress testing and scenario analysis mandates (e.g., CCAR in US, ICAAP in UK).

In particular, GRA has model development ownership for several regional climate risk scenario analysis models, covering both transition risk (posed to clients in transition to low-carbon economy) and physical risk (posed by acute weather events) for different asset classes (e.g., corporate bond, municipal bonds, real estate, and wholesale loans).  The team is also developing machine-learning models to assess the TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures) and sustainability reports by clients in different industry sectors.

Climate risk analytics is an emerging field. Institutions around the world (e.g., regulators, banks, vendors, etc.) are grappling with the challenges in how to enhance the data, scenario design, and methodology. At this stage, GRA is currently developing a unified platform to onboard different “climate risk + machine learning” modules, and potentially utilizing open-source data (if deemed appropriate) for research purposes.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying data analytics and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching open-source data platforms for climate risk, and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications. The candidate will learn data analytics and machine learning with applications in climate risk.

What will you do?

  • Assist to research open-source data and analytics platforms, such as OS-Climate, Oasis, Climate Analytics CIE, WRI Aqueduct, World Bank CCKP.
  • Identify use cases of the open-source platforms.
  • Assist to design and implement Python-based tools for climate risk related applications.
  • Make presentation to senior people in risk

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong programming experience in Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge about machine learning, data analytics, and data visualization
  • Ability to communicate technical matters in written and oral forms
  • Team players to collaborate and innovate

Nice-to-have

  • Interest in learning about emerging data and techniques to assess climate risk impact.
  • Understand of the big picture regarding how risk function works in banks
  • Knowledge of financial products in trading book and banking book.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

Apply data analytics and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching open-source data platforms for climate risk and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications.

item.title: Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics, you will report to the Director, Portfolio Mgmt and Analytics. The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

This role gives the incumbent the opportunity to build on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behavior and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment. This position specializes in insight-generation through in-depth portfolio analytics with a focus on Stage 3 PCL.

What will you do?

  • Lead reviews around Stage 3 PCL portfolio analytics for Cards and identify trends that support recommendations on PCL mid-month and month end estimates sent to P&CB and GRM Senior Management, Five Year Outlook, Annual Plan and quarterly forecast.
  • Lead deep dive analytics and provide early warning indicators to facilitate recommendations for areas of concern to highlight to executives.
  • Develop enhanced monthly dashboard that provides transparency on Stage 3 PCL performance for increased awareness of senior leadership around the largest portfolio within Canadian banking balance sheet.   
  • Lead, as subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities towards PCL applications (activities include, but are not limited to: data analysis, aggregation, interpretation, and recommendation).
  • Lead preparation of Executive level presentation for PMCS, GRM and Sr. Management and Investor Relations which provides an early quarterly view of emerging Cards credit risk profile.
  • Assist Sr. Director, Portfolio Management & Analytics in preparing Executive level presentations for VP PMCS to present at P&CB Operating Committee’s Credit Risk Update.
  • Support action plans through to implementation
  • Develop and execute routines to measure and monitor effectiveness of policy and process changes to determine success and make adjustment recommendations where required
  • Support PM&CS initiatives, analytics, and adhoc requests as required

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Economics, Statistics or other quantitative field of study
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written)
  • 5+ years related work experience with SQL, SAS or equivalent programming experience, and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment
  • Proven analytical skills
  • Strong understanding of consumer behavior and credit risk
  • Proven ability to connect process, policy, system, and data together and establish impact when any of the above changes
  • Collaborative and supportive attitude
  • Creative thinker to solve complex problems
  • Ability to impact and influence is critical as this is a leadership position

Nice-to-have    

  • Knowledge of Teradata, DB2, Oracle, Tableau, Python
  • Working knowledge of Personal Financing Products.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities      
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Job Summary

The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

item.title: Senior Product Manager Business Deposits & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Product Manager Business Deposits & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently looking for a Senior Product Manager reporting into the Business Liquidity & Deposit Solutions team.  This Product Management leader role with specialization in analytics and portfolio insights for Business deposits. will apply data science & analytics expertise along with strong business acumen to surface relevant insights and recommend actions.   You will lead key strategic initiatives for Business Deposits including interest rate pricing along with risk and growth strategies for the entire portfolio.  You will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments, and will focus on the analytics and portfolio insights for business deposits and liquidity solutions supporting the needs of the business. You will apply data & analytics expertise along with strong business acumen to surface relevant insights and recommend actions.

From tracking market rate movements, engaging treasury and the field on how business deposits are behaving, and supporting pricing and analytics to broader flow of funds across the portfolio- this is an exciting role very much entrenched into one of the largest revenue contributors to Business Financial Services. The role will require utilizing data & analytics expertise to surface insights along with a good balance of storytelling, and cross-collaboration with stakeholders to drive market share volume growth along with net interest income growth.

What will you do?

  • Manage analytics “infrastructure” particularly our Flow of Funds tool and support to continually monitor performance on all aspects of deposit volume and associated revenues across all the relevant segments and sectors within BFS.

  • Deliver accurate and timely analytics that enable the business to meet both short term and long term Market Share objectives. This also includes the needed analytics for on-going reviews including monthly & quarterly Business Review Deliverables for BD&TS 

  • Lead data analytics initiatives and identify insights opportunities for BD&TS portfolio, partnering with BDTS SMT and Enterprise Analytics team  (DNA) to optimize portfolio and revenue growth

  • Act as a partner and subject matter expert to the team on RBC internal data

  • Deliver end-to-end analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner

  • Communicate, frame and align analytical objectives with senior leaders

  • Own, automate, and standardize deposits portfolio analyses and work collaboratively with partners from Corporate Treasury

  • Build and maintain complex queries, reports and dashboards for products & features that drive value in pricing decisions and customer conversations

  • Promote analytics across the broader team to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization

  • As may be assigned, product oversight on all interest bearing accounts including negotiated products, administered rate products, GICs as well as the NIM for non-interest bearing accounts ensuring commitment to RBC values, employee engagement, employee accountability, and building a diverse work environment, delegating authority and accountability required to deliver superior client experience, high performance & profitability

  • Implement product strategy, process supporting all segment strategies for Business Financial Service Accounts to sustain and improve RBC’s competitive position and client experience in its key markets

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University degree in Quantitative field of study (e.g Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering)  and/or MBA – Role requires broad business management insight and knowledge, especially in Business Sector Behaviour

  • 5-10 years in Data Science/Finance/Analytics field

  • Significant experience in utilizing advanced SQL to build meaningful data views

  • Expert programming skills with Python. Proficient with data manipulation and visualization libraries/frameworks

  • Expert visualization skills with Tableau

  • Effective and comfortable in business and technical environment.

  • Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

  • Strong Project Management skills

  • Influencing skills

  • Strong PowerPoint skills in creating and presenting

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in payment and cash management

  • Bank Liabilities/Deposits Management & Interest Rate Risk Knowledge

  • Product Management experience

  • Agile Methodology

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact which includes exposure to key decision makers throughout the organization

  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunity to take on progressively responsibilities commensurate with your performance

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-21-08:00

Application Deadline:

2022-12-21-08:00

item.title: Associate Director, Environmental and Social Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Environmental and Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

RBC is hiring an Associate Director to join our rapidly-growing Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team in Group Risk Management (GRM). You will play a key role in enabling, advancing and optimizing data, analytics and reporting capabilities in the E&S Risk domain.

What will you do?

  • Support Director, Environmental & Social Risk – Product Management to develop and optimize the data pipelines and data models to enable on-going environmental and social risk monitoring, reporting and analytics.
  • Develop/enhance models to optimize data coverage and data accuracy of environment and social risk’s metrics
  • Collaborate with Environmental and Social Risk Analytics team and IT Development team to transition from process and models from proof of concept, prototype, and to production.
  • Work with Data Strategy and Governance team to build controls to ensure team has confidence the environmental and social risk measurements
  • Be the subject matter expert in Environmental and Social Risk data and process domain

What do you need to Succeed?

Must have:

  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages (e.g. SQL, python)
  • Demonstrated ability to build scalable and sound data processes and models
  • Demonstrated ability to work with large and complex data
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights.
  • A desire and ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems.
  • Comfort working in an evolving fast-paced environment
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Nice to have:

  • Experience in Risk Management / Credit Risk
  • Experience in Social & Environmental Risk, or familiarity with climate change, financed emissions, the Partnership for Carbon Accounting (PCAF) reporting standard
  • Experience launching products that use innovative technologies such as machine learning / AI

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

RBC is hiring an Associate Director to join our rapidly-growing Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team in Group Risk Management (GRM). You will play a key role in enabling, advancing and optimizing data, analytics and reporting capabilities in the E&S Risk domain.
